channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Your occasional reminder: Even inanimate objects are allowed accounts on this site. Which makes you really wonder about the moral character of former presidents who aren’t. https://t.co/FuWAOALKgO
And @bogiperson once again finds three very apt excerpts from @BenYehudaPress to help meditate on this difficult parsha at the end of what has been a very difficult week. https://t.co/FoOSzbjC24
@allshiny Wait. What? And is there a North Jersey (aka Teaneck) angle?
Some Torah principles for thinking about gun control. https://t.co/e3jybJeZZd
@scalzi Sugar would have more moral authority judging from a church lectern. Just saying.

@DylanRevisited It’s funny, because the case has been made that the assassination is was enabled the Civil Rights bills to be passed the following year.
@DylanRevisited Of course, seeing in 1965 that his political judgement had been wrong two years earlier would be even more reason to step away from politics. Which is what he did.
@jnack @okaysamurai What if you prompt it, “this, but each cat in a slightly different position”?

@ChaimGottheil @ShulimLeifer @rose625 @JewWhoHasItAll @needmoarcoffee1 It is certainly does not always work and it is also true that It Gets Better. And in hindsight, that $5 bill may have been a way to postpone the decision at a moment when I didn’t trust myself to make the right choice.
What brave new world, that has such machine-generated cat pics in it. https://t.co/rvfyeUCJWv

@ShulimLeifer @rose625 @ChaimGottheil @JewWhoHasItAll @needmoarcoffee1 Related: At the time when I most depressed, more than a decade ago, I kept a $5 bill in my wallet so I would have the option to take the bus to the GWB if I wanted to. I wonder how I would have received such a “joke”.
@babyboymonaghan All of Summer in a Day by Bradbury knocked me out in sixth grade. Not assigned but found on the classroom shelves.

@babyboymonaghan Have you seen the refutations?
@babyboymonaghan @jamesdnicoll wrote one: https://t.co/KM88QVZlpO
@savelakewoodnj A halachic discussion of the issue from a Bergen County rabbi: https://t.co/ZsPUhFSe7S
@AkivaMCohen Interesting how a self-proclaimed Orthodox Jew never addresses the halachic precedents that would mandate serious gun control. E.g. this from a local rabbi: https://t.co/ZsPUhFSe7S

@TfTHacker Two others I would add: PCOutline, which stood outlining from @davewiner and memory residence (remember that?!) from Sidekick. I lived in that for several years.
@TfTHacker @davewiner Now, I use the primitive @NotionHQ outline features as part of relying on Notion to keep track of my myriad tasks and sub tasks. It’s not perfect, but the Kanban view is indispensable.

@froomkin One of the Times’ financial responsibilities is to ensure that Republican in the owners social circle, Republican advertisers, and Republican subscribers don’t turn against the paper because it makes them feel bad. That is what drives the political coverage.
@studentactivism @swordsjew Rounding shows you’re not serious. Make it $42,420.69. Remind Americans that every penny counts.
@YehudahMirsky Regards from the person who called R Eliezer Berkovits from Washington Heights to get the psak for the first US Orthodox minyan in which women led Kabbalah Shabbat.
@bruces I often wonder this about the dinosaurs. How much can we say for sure that there were no dinosaurs who had writing systems?
Strange New Worlds, as (would have been) seen on TV (via VCR). https://t.co/jWlj1ZbMo4
Crime family crimed. https://t.co/OECnquFuJB
Wondering whether the fine folks at @OrthodoxUnion plan to protest this ban against some important halachicly acceptable forms of birth control. https://t.co/33g8jORGnk
@onthemainline Blockchain, but for philosophical transactions.
@NathanJRobinson Give the police suitcase nukes.
